div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, September 21, 1899
div1.opener:
DR. JESSE W. LAZEAR,
835 PARK AVE.
OFFICE HOURS,
4.30-6 P. M.
BALTIMORE. Sep. 21 99
My dear Mother,-
div1.p:
I fully intended writing to you
yesterday to tell you of the safe arrival of Mabel
and the baby. I am glad you are going
to stay a little longer at Hatley. There
is still a possibility of more warm weather.
It was warm here the first of the week
but today is very comfortable and cool.
Uncle Tom returned to Pittsburgh on
Saturday. I was not able to see much
of him. Aunt Kate still has trouble
with her knee and she does not
look very well.

The baby stood the trip very well and is
looking splendid. He sleeps better now
than he did months ago. He makes
up in activity when he is awake. It
is hard to keep him in his carriage.
Aunt Alice has not done well where
she is staying near Asheville. She
does not expect to return home this
DR. JESSE W. LAZEAR,
835 PARK AVE.
OFFICE HOURS,
4.30-6 P. M.
BALTIMORE.
fall but will go directly to here
winter quarters.

I suppose the crowd will thin out
rapidly at North Hatley.

Have you given up your visit to
Atlantic City?
